definition: Chinese mugwort or wormwood/moxa/to stop or cut short/phonetic "ai" or "i"/abbr. for 艾滋病[ai4 zi1 bing4], AIDS
abbr. for 哈薩克斯坦|哈萨克斯坦[Ha1 sa4 ke4 si1 tan3], Kazakhstan/abbr. for 哈爾濱|哈尔滨[Ha1 er3 bin1], Harbin
(interj.) ha!/(onom. for laughter)/(slang) to be infatuated with/to adore/abbr. for 哈士奇[ha1 shi4 qi2], husky (dog)
Germany/German/abbr. for 德國|德国[De2 guo2]

sentences.english: Shortly after, Ahmed named Professor Muhamed Ghedi as his new prime minister.
sentences.chinese: 不久之后，艾哈迈德穆罕默德格迪教授命名为新总理。

sentences.english: Judge Ahmed Refaat was clearly not happy.
sentences.chinese: 艾哈迈德Refaat法官显然不乐意。

sentences.english: Ahmad was asked about removing the pubic hair with scissors.
sentences.chinese: 艾哈迈德被问到使用剪刀去除阴毛的事。

sentences.english: Ahmed congratulated Premier Wen on the success of his visits.
sentences.chinese: 艾哈迈德祝贺温家宝访孟取得圆满成功。

definition: Mohammed (c. 570-632), central figure of Islam and prophet of God
Husain or Hussein (name)/Hussein (c. 626-680), Muslim leader whose martyrdom is commemorated at Ashura/Saddam Hussein al Tikriti (1937-2006), dictator of Iraq 1979-2003
Mohammed (c. 570-632), central figure of Islam and prophet of God/also written 穆罕默德
Bashir (name)/Omar Hassan Ahmad al-Bashir (1944-), Sudanese military man and politician, president of Sudan from 1993
Suleiman (name)/General Michel Suleiman (1948-), Lebanese military man and politician, president of Lebanon 2008-2014
Anwar (name)/Anwar bin Ibrahim (1947-), Malaysian politician, deputy prime minister 1993-1998, imprisoned 1999-2004 on charges including alleged homosexual acts, subsequently overturned
Massoud (name)/Ahmed Shah Massoud (1953-2001), Tajik Afghan engineer, military man and anti-Taleban leader
Sudan/sultan (ruler of some Muslim states, esp. Ottoman Emperor)
